speaker: PRINCE
text: I do but stay till your marriage be consummate,

speaker: PRINCE
text: and then go I toward Aragon.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: I’ll bring you thither, my lord, if you’ll vouchsafe

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: me.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Nay, that would be as great a soil in the new

speaker: PRINCE
text: gloss of your marriage as to show a child his new

speaker: PRINCE
text: coat and forbid him to wear it. I will only be bold

speaker: PRINCE
text: with Benedick for his company, for from the crown

speaker: PRINCE
text: of his head to the sole of his foot he is all mirth. He

speaker: PRINCE
text: hath twice or thrice cut Cupid’s bowstring, and the

speaker: PRINCE
text: little hangman dare not shoot at him. He hath a

speaker: PRINCE
text: heart as sound as a bell, and his tongue is the

speaker: PRINCE
text: clapper, for what his heart thinks, his tongue

speaker: PRINCE
text: speaks.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Gallants, I am not as I have been.

speaker: LEONATO
text: So say I. Methinks you are sadder.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: I hope he be in love.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Hang him, truant! There’s no true drop of

speaker: PRINCE
text: blood in him to be truly touched with love. If he be

speaker: PRINCE
text: sad, he wants money.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I have the toothache.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Draw it.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Hang it!

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: You must hang it first, and draw it afterwards.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What, sigh for the toothache?

speaker: LEONATO
text: Where is but a humor or a worm.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Well, everyone can master a grief but he

speaker: BENEDICK
text: that has it.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Yet say I, he is in love.

speaker: PRINCE
text: There is no appearance of fancy in him, unless

speaker: PRINCE
text: it be a fancy that he hath to strange disguises, as to

speaker: PRINCE
text: be a Dutchman today, a Frenchman tomorrow, or

speaker: PRINCE
text: in the shape of two countries at once, as a German

speaker: PRINCE
text: from the waist downward, all slops, and a Spaniard

speaker: PRINCE
text: from the hip upward, no doublet. Unless he have a

speaker: PRINCE
text: fancy to this foolery, as it appears he hath, he is no

speaker: PRINCE
text: fool for fancy, as you would have it appear he is.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: If he be not in love with some woman, there

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: is no believing old signs. He brushes his hat o’

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: mornings. What should that bode?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Hath any man seen him at the barber’s?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: No, but the barber’s man hath been seen

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: with him, and the old ornament of his cheek hath

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: already stuffed tennis balls.

speaker: LEONATO
text: Indeed he looks younger than he did, by the

speaker: LEONATO
text: loss of a beard.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Nay, he rubs himself with civet. Can you smell

speaker: PRINCE
text: him out by that?

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: That’s as much as to say, the sweet youth’s in

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: love.

speaker: PRINCE
text: The greatest note of it is his melancholy.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: And when was he wont to wash his face?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Yea, or to paint himself? For the which I hear

speaker: PRINCE
text: what they say of him.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Nay, but his jesting spirit, which is now crept

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: into a lute string and now governed by stops—

speaker: PRINCE
text: Indeed, that tells a heavy tale for him. Conclude,

speaker: PRINCE
text: conclude, he is in love.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Nay, but I know who loves him.

speaker: PRINCE
text: That would I know, too. I warrant, one that

speaker: PRINCE
text: knows him not.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Yes, and his ill conditions; and, in despite of

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: all, dies for him.

speaker: PRINCE
text: She shall be buried with her face upwards.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Yet is this no charm for the toothache.—

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Old signior, walk aside with me. I have studied eight

speaker: BENEDICK
text: or nine wise words to speak to you, which these

speaker: BENEDICK
text: hobby-horses must not hear.

speaker: PRINCE
text: For my life, to break with him about Beatrice!

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: ’Tis even so. Hero and Margaret have by this

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: played their parts with Beatrice, and then the two

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: bears will not bite one another when they meet.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: My lord and brother, God save you.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Good e’en, brother.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: If your leisure served, I would speak with

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: you.

speaker: PRINCE
text: In private?

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: If it please you. Yet Count Claudio may

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: hear, for what I would speak of concerns him.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What’s the matter?

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: Means your Lordship to be

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: married tomorrow?

speaker: PRINCE
text: You know he does.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: I know not that, when he knows what I

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: know.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: If there be any impediment, I pray you discover

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: it.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: You may think I love you not. Let that

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: appear hereafter, and aim better at me by that I

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: now will manifest. For my brother, I think he holds

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: you well, and in dearness of heart hath holp to effect

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: your ensuing marriage—surely suit ill spent and

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: labor ill bestowed.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Why, what’s the matter?

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: I came hither to tell you; and, circumstances

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: shortened, for she has been too long

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: a-talking of, the lady is disloyal.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Who, Hero?

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: Even she: Leonato’s Hero, your Hero, every

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: man’s Hero.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: Disloyal?

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: The word is too good to paint out her

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: wickedness. I could say she were worse. Think you

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: of a worse title, and I will fit her to it. Wonder not

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: till further warrant. Go but with me tonight, you

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: shall see her chamber window entered, even the

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: night before her wedding day. If you love her then,

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: tomorrow wed her. But it would better fit your

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: honor to change your mind.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: May this be so?

speaker: PRINCE
text: I will not think it.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: If you dare not trust that you see, confess

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: not that you know. If you will follow me, I will

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: show you enough, and when you have seen more

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: and heard more, proceed accordingly.

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: If I see anything tonight why I should not

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: marry her, tomorrow in the congregation, where I

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: should wed, there will I shame her.

speaker: PRINCE
text: And as I wooed for thee to obtain her, I will

speaker: PRINCE
text: join with thee to disgrace her.

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: I will disparage her no farther till you are

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: my witnesses. Bear it coldly but till midnight, and

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: let the issue show itself.

speaker: PRINCE
text: O day untowardly turned!

speaker: CLAUDIO
text: O mischief strangely thwarting!

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: O plague right well prevented! So will you

speaker:
DON
               
              JOHN
text: say when you have seen the sequel.
